body: This resume has a very unappealing layout. I recommend using [canva.com](https://www.canva.com/https://www.google.com) or [google templates](https://docs.google.com/document/u/0/?ftv=1&tgif=c) so you don't have to spend so much time on design. I want to make sure you have a resume template you like and can easily update by the time we start applying to jobs in class.
Display your contact info (gitHub, LinkedIn, phone, email) more clearly at the top of your resume.
Contact.description: No contact info or poorly placed

body: Add a skills section. They are expected with tech resumes. List revelent technical and non-technical skills first followed by any other skills not mentioned in the job posting.

Add a project section featuring 2-3 projects. A project section is a great way to demonstrate you have the skills stated in your resume. In BookFace's job posting, they are even looking for someone to help build a web application. It would go a long way to show you have built several yourself already. For each project include a url to the GitHub repo (ex: github.com/username/repo-name), a brief description of the project the average user could understand, and technologies used.
